info.name: RFID Jewelry Inventory System - Complete API Collection v5
info.description:
Complete API collection for RFID Jewelry Inventory Management System with Multi-Tenant Architecture, Admin-User Hierarchy System, Granular Permissions, Activity Tracking, Product Management, Image Upload, RFID Tracking, Comprehensive Reporting System, RFID Usage Analytics, Database Management, Branch/Counter Assignment for Sub-User Registration, Email Integration (Welcome & Notification Emails), Password Reset Functionality, User Profile Management (Profile Image Upload, Extended Address, Bio, Designation), Custom Fields for Products, Bulk Product Upload via Excel (100,000+ products), and Comprehensive Dashboard & Analytics APIs.

**‚ú® Enhanced Features:**
- ‚úÖ **Standardized Response Format**: All endpoints return consistent `{ success, message, data }` format
- ‚úÖ **Comprehensive Validation**: ModelState validation, parameter validation, and business rule validation
- ‚úÖ **Perfect Error Handling**: Consistent error responses with detailed messages
- ‚úÖ **Permission Management**: Proper MainAdmin vs Admin vs User permission checks
- ‚úÖ **Self-Protection**: Prevents self-deletion and self-deactivation
- ‚úÖ **Input Validation**: All DTOs have proper validation attributes

All endpoints with real data examples and proper localhost URLs.

request.description: Request a password reset token. The token will be sent via email (in production) or returned in the response (for testing). Token is valid for 24 hours.

exec: console.log('Warning: resetToken not found in environment. Please run Forgot Password request first.');

request.description: Reset password using the token received from forgot password request. The token is valid for 24 hours. Password must be at least 6 characters and passwords must match.
Reset password with manually entered token. Use this if you have the token from a previous forgot password request.
Upload profile image for the current user. Supported formats: JPG, JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP, WEBP. Max file size: 5MB. The image will be stored and can be accessed via the profile image URL.

Get current user's profile information including profile image, extended address details, bio, and designation.
Get complete user profile including user data, profile information, and profile completion percentage.
Get profile completion percentage based on filled profile fields. Profile is considered complete at 80% threshold.
Delete the current user's profile image. This will remove both the file and database record.
Get profile information for a specific user by ID. Only accessible by admins or the user themselves.

formdata.description: JSON string containing product data. Include 'images' array with metadata (optional - if not provided, first image will be Primary, rest will be Secondary)
Product image files (one or more). First image will be marked as Primary if metadata not provided.

request.description: Create a new product with one or more images. The productData should be a JSON string containing all product information. Images can be uploaded as files. If image metadata is not provided in productData, the first image will be marked as Primary and others as Secondary.

request.description: Delete a single product by ID. This will also delete associated images, custom fields, and RFID assignments.

WARNING: Delete ALL products for the current client. This will permanently delete all products, product images (physical files), custom fields, and RFID assignments. This action cannot be undone. Use with extreme caution!
Download Excel template for bulk product upload. Template includes all required fields, example data, and instructions. Supports up to 100,000 products efficiently.

Export all products to Excel file with all fields including: Id, ItemCode, CategoryName, BranchName, CounterName, ProductName, DesignName, PurityName, RfidCode, BoxDetails, GrossWeight, StoneWeight, DiamondHeight, NetWeight, Size, StoneAmount, DiamondAmount, HallmarkAmount, MakingPerGram, MakingPercentage, MakingFixedAmount, MRP, ImageUrl, Status, CreatedOn, and CustomFields (as JSON). The file will be downloaded with a timestamp in the filename.

formdata.description: Excel file (.xlsx) with product data. Can contain up to 100,000 products.
Whether to update existing products (by ItemCode). Default: false
Whether to skip rows with errors and continue processing. Default: true

request.description: Upload products from Excel file. Optimized for bulk processing (100,000+ products). Processes in batches of 1000 for optimal performance. Returns detailed summary with success/error counts and processing time. Supports custom fields via JSON column.

formdata.description: Whether to update existing RFID codes with new EPC values
Whether to create new RFID codes if they don't exist

request.description:
Upload RFID data from Excel file. The Excel should have 2 columns:
- Column 1: RFID Code (max 50 characters)
- Column 2: EPC Value (max 100 characters)

Features:
‚úÖ Bulk upload support
‚úÖ Update existing RFID codes
‚úÖ Create new RFID codes
‚úÖ Validation and error reporting
‚úÖ Duplicate detection
‚úÖ File size limit: 10MB
‚úÖ Supported formats: .xlsx, .xls

Excel Format:
| RFID Code | EPC Value |
|------------|-----------|
| RFID001   | EPC123456 |
| RFID002   | EPC789012 |
| RFID003   | EPC345678 |

Note: If RFID Code exists, EPC Value will be updated. If RFID Code doesn't exist, new record will be created.

Download Excel template for RFID upload. The template includes:
‚úÖ Pre-filled headers (RFID Code, EPC Value)
‚úÖ Sample data rows
‚úÖ Instructions for proper formatting
‚úÖ Styled headers and sample data
‚úÖ Auto-fitted columns

Use this template to ensure correct Excel format for RFID uploads.

item.name: Create Invoice with Multiple Payment Methods

  "sellingPrice": 95000.00,
  "discountAmount": 5000.00,

  "isGstApplied": false,
  "gstPercentage": 3.00,
  "invoiceType": "Sale",
  "paymentMethods": [
    {
      "paymentMethod": "Cash",
      "amount": 50000.00,
      "paymentReference": "CASH001",
      "remarks": "Cash payment"
    },
    {
      "paymentMethod": "UPI",
      "amount": 40000.00,
      "paymentReference": "UPI123456789",
      "remarks": "UPI payment via PhonePe"
    }
  ],
  "soldOn": "2024-01-15T10:00:00Z",
  "remarks": "Kaccha Bill - Customer paid partially in cash and rest via UPI"
}

item.name: Get All Invoices with Payment Details
Add ProductImage Table to All Clients
üëë Admin Management System
item.description:
Comprehensive admin management APIs with perfect validation, error handling, and permission management.

**‚ú® Key Features:**
- ‚úÖ **Standardized Response Format**: All endpoints return `{ success: true/false, message: "...", data: ... }`
- ‚úÖ **Comprehensive Validation**: ModelState validation, parameter validation (user IDs, dates, pagination), and business rules
- ‚úÖ **Perfect Error Handling**: Consistent error responses with detailed validation error messages
- ‚úÖ **Permission Management**: Proper MainAdmin vs Admin vs User permission checks
- ‚úÖ **Self-Protection**: Prevents self-deletion and self-deactivation
- ‚úÖ **Input Validation**: All DTOs have proper validation attributes ([Required], [StringLength], [Range], etc.)

**Response Format Examples:**

**Success Response:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "User updated successfully.",
  "data": { ... }
}
```

**Error Response:**
```json
{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Invalid user ID.",
  "errors": ["User ID must be greater than 0"]
}
```

**Validation Rules:**
- User IDs must be > 0
- Page numbers must be >= 1
- Page size must be between 1 and 100
- Start date cannot be greater than end date
- Password must be at least 6 characters
- All required fields are validated via ModelState

body.raw:
{
  "userName": "admin2@jewelrystore.com",
  "email": "admin2@jewelrystore.com",
  "password": "Admin@123",
  "fullName": "Jane Admin",
  "mobileNumber": "+91-9876543211",
  "city": "Mumbai",
  "address": "456 Admin Street, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India",
  "organisationName": "Premium Jewelry Store",
  "showroomType": "Premium",
  "isAdmin": true,
  "userType": "Admin",
  "adminUserId": null
}

request.description:
Register a new admin user (Main Admin only). After successful registration, two emails are automatically sent:
1. ‚ú® Beautiful Welcome Email - Sent to the new admin user with Sparkle RFID Dashboard branding, account details, and dashboard access link
2. üìß Notification Email - Sent to the main admin who created the user with registration details

Note: Emails are sent asynchronously and do not affect the user creation process. If SMTP is not configured, emails are skipped with a warning in logs.

exec: console.log('Admin user registered successfully with ID:', response.data.userId);
console.log('   - ‚ú® Welcome email sent to:', response.data.email);
console.log('   - üìß Notification email sent to main admin');

}

request.description:
Register a new sub-user under admin. After successful registration, two emails are automatically sent:
1. ‚ú® Beautiful Welcome Email - Sent to the new user with Sparkle RFID Dashboard branding, account details, and dashboard access link
2. üìß Notification Email - Sent to the admin who created the user with registration details

Note: Emails are sent asynchronously and do not affect the user creation process. If SMTP is not configured, emails are skipped with a warning in logs.

exec: console.log('Sub-user registered successfully with ID:', response.data.userId);
console.log('   - ‚ú® Welcome email sent to:', response.data.email);
console.log('   - üìß Notification email sent to admin');
console.log('   - Check inboxes for beautiful Sparkle RFID Dashboard emails!');

request.description:
Get all users managed by the current admin. Returns standardized response with success, message, data, and count.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Users retrieved successfully.",
  "data": [...],
  "count": 10
}
```

**Validation:**
- Page number must be >= 1
- Page size must be between 1 and 100

item.name: Get Users Under Admin with Pagination

request.description:
Get user permissions by user ID. Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
  "data": [...]
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Admin must have access to the user

Get all user permissions in organization (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
  "data": [...]
}
```

**Validation:**
- Only admins can view all permissions
- Client code must be present in token

request.description:
Create/Assign permissions to user (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permissions assigned successfully."
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Permissions list cannot be empty
- Module is required for each permission
- Only admins can assign permissions
- ModelState validation

request.description:
Update user permissions (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permissions updated successfully."
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Permissions list cannot be empty
- Module is required for each permission
- Only admins can update permissions
- ModelState validation

Remove all permissions from user (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "All permissions removed successfully."
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Only admins can remove permissions
- Admin must have access to the user

Remove specific permission from user (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permission for module 'Product' removed successfully."
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Module name is required
- Only admins can remove permissions
- Admin must have access to the user

Bulk update permissions for multiple users (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permissions updated successfully for all users."
}
```

**Validation:**
- User IDs list cannot be empty
- Permissions list cannot be empty
- Only admins can update permissions
- ModelState validation

Bulk remove permissions for multiple users (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permissions removed successfully for all users."
}
```

**Validation:**
- User IDs list cannot be empty
- If removeAll is false, modules list cannot be empty
- Only admins can remove permissions
- ModelState validation

Get available permission modules (Admin only). Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Modules retrieved successfully.",
  "data": ["Product", "RFID", "Invoice", ...]
}
```

**Validation:**
- Only admins can view available modules

Get permission summary for user. Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Permission summary retrieved successfully.",
  "data": { ... }
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Admin must have access to the user

Get user activities with filters. Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Activities retrieved successfully.",
  "data": [...],
  "count": 50
}
```

**Validation:**
- Page number must be >= 1
- Page size must be between 1 and 100
- Start date cannot be greater than end date
- User ID must be > 0 if provided

Get user activities with comprehensive filters. Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Activities retrieved successfully.",
  "data": [...],
  "count": 20
}
```

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate` (optional): Start date for filtering
- `endDate` (optional): End date for filtering
- `userId` (optional): Filter by specific user ID
- `activityType` (optional): Filter by module/activity type
- `action` (optional): Filter by action (Create, Update, Delete, etc.)
- `page` (default: 1): Page number
- `pageSize` (default: 20, max: 100): Number of items per page

**Validation:**
- Page number must be >= 1
- Page size must be between 1 and 100
- Start date cannot be greater than end date

Get activities for a specific user. Returns standardized response format.

**Response Format:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "User activities retrieved successfully.",
  "data": [...],
  "count": 25
}
```

**Validation:**
- User ID must be > 0
- Admin must have access to the user
- Client code must be present in token

request.description:
Register a new sub-user with branch/counter assignment. After successful registration, two emails are automatically sent:
1. ‚ú® Beautiful Welcome Email - Sent to the new user with Sparkle RFID Dashboard branding, account details, and dashboard access link
2. üìß Notification Email - Sent to the admin who created the user with registration details

Note: Emails are sent asynchronously and do not affect the user creation process. If SMTP is not configured, emails are skipped with a warning in logs.

exec: console.log('Counter user registered successfully with ID:', response.userId);
console.log('Assigned to Branch ID:', response.branchId, 'Counter ID:', response.counterId);
console.log('   - ‚ú® Welcome email sent to:', response.email);
console.log('   - üìß Notification email sent to admin');

request.description: Create a new stock verification session for tracking scanned items, matched/unmatched products, and generating reports. Use branchName and counterName instead of IDs for better user experience.
Submit scanned items for verification. Separate matched and unmatched item codes. The system will automatically calculate missing items and values.
Get detailed information about a specific stock verification session including all scanned items and their status.

Get paginated list of stock verification sessions with filters for date range, branch name, counter name, category, status, and verified by. Use branchName and counterName instead of IDs for better user experience.
Get overall summary statistics of all stock verification sessions including total counts, values, and recent sessions.
Get comprehensive date-wise stock verification report showing daily statistics, sessions, and item counts for the specified date range.
Mark a stock verification session as completed. This will finalize the session and prevent further modifications.
Cancel a stock verification session. This will mark the session as cancelled and prevent further modifications.
Get verification details filtered by status. Valid statuses: Matched, Unmatched, Missing. For matched items, includes full product details.
Create a new stock transfer between branches, counters, or boxes. Transfer types: Branch, Counter, Box, Mixed.
Create multiple stock transfers in bulk with common reason and remarks.
Get a specific transfer by its ID with complete details including source/destination locations and product information.
Get all transfers with optional filtering by status, location, dates, and pagination.
Approve a pending transfer. Changes status from Pending to In Transit.
Reject a pending transfer with reason. Changes status to Rejected.
Complete a transfer in In Transit status. Moves product to destination and updates status to Completed.
Cancel a pending or in-transit transfer. Changes status to Cancelled.
Get comprehensive transfer summary including counts by status, transfer types, and branch summaries.
Get all transfer history for a specific product ID.
Get all transfer history for a specific RFID code.
Get all pending transfers for a specific location (branch, counter, box).
Validate if a transfer is possible before creating it. Checks product existence, location validity, and no pending transfers.
Get available transfer types: Branch, Counter, Box, Mixed.
Get available transfer statuses: Pending, In Transit, Completed, Cancelled, Rejected.
Get complete transfer history for a product including all statuses and locations.

item.name: Get Dashboard Summary (All Metrics in One Call)

request.description:
Get comprehensive dashboard summary with all important metrics in a single API call. Returns:
- Product Metrics: Total products, active products, sold products, recently added count
- Weight Metrics: Total gross weight, net weight, stone weight, averages
- Sales Metrics: Total revenue, sales count, average order value, month growth, current/previous month sales
- Customer Metrics: Total customers, invoices, active customers
- Category & Branch Metrics: Total categories, branches, counters, top category
- Inventory Value: Total inventory value, average product price
- RFID Metrics: Total tags, used tags, unused tags

This is the recommended endpoint for dashboard overview as it returns all key metrics in one optimized call.

Get comprehensive dashboard data including total products, sold products, recently added products, monthly sales, sales growth, user product creations, top selling products, weight by category, and customer summary.
Get total count of all products in the system.
Get total count of products that have been sold (from invoices and stock movements).

query.description: Number of recently added products to retrieve (default: 10)

request.description: Get recently added products ordered by creation date. Returns product details including item code, product name, category, branch, counter, MRP, and gross weight.

query.description: Number of months to retrieve sales data (default: 12)

request.description: Get sales data aggregated by month for the specified number of months. Returns monthly sales count and total sales amount.
Get sales month growth percentage comparing current month sales with previous month sales.
Get which user added which products. Returns a list of users with their product creation details including product IDs, item codes, product names, and creation dates.

query.description: Number of top selling products to retrieve (default: 10)

request.description: Get top selling products based on sales count. Returns product details including total sold count, total sales amount, and average selling price.
Get total weight of all products grouped by category. Returns product count, total gross weight, total net weight, and total stone weight for each category.
Get customer summary information including total customers, total invoices, total revenue, average order value, and top customers list.

Download all dashboard data in Excel format. The Excel file contains multiple sheets:
- Dashboard Summary: Key metrics
- Recently Added Products: Latest products
- Monthly Sales: Sales data by month
- User Product Creations: Which user created which products
- Top Selling Products: Best selling products
- Weight by Category: Total weight grouped by category
- Customer Summary: Customer information and top customers
